Description: The lifetime over which the the cost of the assets is reduced
The type of the Capital Expenditures cash flow. The "one- time" type is suitable for capital expenditure cash flows
Determines how inflation affects the Capital Expenditures cash flow every cycle
Indicates whether this parameter (Capital Expenditures cash flow) should be a target of the multiplication factor for Net Present Value matching analyses.
Determines whether the Capital Expenditures cash flow is taxed every cycle
The Capital Expenditures cash flow reference price fixed value
Determines the scaling factor for this CashFlow. Corresponds to X in the CashFlow equation
The type of the fixed operation and maintenance cash flow. The "repeating" type is suitable for repeating costs such as operations and maintenance (fixed or variable)
Determines how inflation affects the fixed operation and maintenance cash flow every cycle
Indicates whether this parameter (fixed operation and maintenance cash flow) should be a target of the multiplication factor for Net Present Value matching analyses.
Determines whether the fixed operation and maintenance cash flow is taxed every cycle
The fixed operation and maintenance cash flow reference price fixed value
The number of cycles (often years) this unit is ex- pected to operate before replacement.
The reference driver determines the number of units sold to which the reference price refers.
The type of the variable operation and maintenance cash flow. The "repeating" type is suitable for repeating costs such as operations and maintenance (fixed or variable),
Determines how inflation affects the variable operation and maintenance cash flow every cycle
Determines whether the variable operation and maintenance cash flow is taxed every cycle
The variable operation and maintenance cash flow reference price fixed value
Indicates whether this parameter (variable operation and maintenance cash flow) should be a target of the multiplication factor for Net Present Value matching analyses.
